message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.AR 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper proposes a low-complexity path division multiple access (PDMA) scheme to enable interference-free multi-user communications in a millimeter wave MIMO system. Information theory concepts such as channel capacity and achievable sum-rate are also discussed. 
2. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper discusses the design of a cost-effective 5G wireless system with large MIMO using lens antenna arrays. The proposed PDMA scheme can also be applied in wireless networks to improve multi-user communication efficiency. 
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper proposes a joint design of analog beamforming at the MSs and digital combining at the BS to maximize the achievable sum-rate of the MSs based on their effective MIMO channels. This involves system optimization and control. 
4. cs.MM (Multimedia): The paper discusses the use of millimeter wave communication for 5G wireless systems, which can support high-speed multimedia applications. 
5. cs.AR (Hardware Architecture): The paper proposes the use of a full-dimensional (FD) lens antenna array at the base station (BS) and conventional uniform planar array (UPA) at the mobile stations (MSs) for a cost-effective millimeter wave MIMO system. The hardware architecture of the proposed system is discussed.
